content:
• Monday, April 9, 2012
  • ADEP

    Microcap robotics firm Adept Technology (NASDAQ:ADEP) continues to run in after hours trading,...

    Microcap robotics firm Adept Technology (NASDAQ:ADEP) continues to run in after hours trading, adding another 7.5% following a nearly 20% gain during the regular session. The company announced late Thursday it had received a $1M order from a German automotive supplier for its Adept 6-axis robot arms to be used in its production line.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) says it's been informed of a three month PDUFA extension by the FDA of for...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) says it's been informed of a three month PDUFA extension by the FDA of for the review of its Qnexa New Drug Application from April 17 to July 17. The FDA is extending the date to provide time for a full review of the submission. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 17 Comments
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine (OTC:ANW) announces a strategic alliance with state-owned China Changjiang Bunker,...

    Aegean Marine (OTC:ANW) announces a strategic alliance with state-owned China Changjiang Bunker, a joint owned enterprise of Sinopec (NYSE:SNP) and Sinotrans. The partnership, which is expected to become effective during FQ2, will enable Aegean to support the growing marine fuel needs of its mainland Chinese customers. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • HLIT

    Harmonic (NASDAQ:HLIT) cuts Q1 guidance, now seeing an EPS of around $0.02 - $0.03 per share on...

    Harmonic (NASDAQ:HLIT) cuts Q1 guidance, now seeing an EPS of around $0.02 - $0.03 per share on revenue of $125M - $128M. Consensus estimates are for $0.09 per share on $137M in revenue. The company says it was adversely impacted by the slower than expected order rate in the early part of the quarter, plus a decline in demand from its European customers. Shares -5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CBS

    Major media companies take a dive after Citigroup slashes its ratings on CBS (CBS -2.2%),...

    Major media companies take a dive after Citigroup slashes its ratings on CBS (CBS -2.2%), Discovery (DISCA -1.7%), Disney (DIS -2.2%) and News Corp. (NWSA -2.2%) to Neutral from Buy. Time Warner (TWX -1.6%) also tumbles even after the firm hikes its price target on the company to $45 from $40.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • STAG

    Stag Industrial (STAG -3.2%) dips after acquiring a warehouse and distribution facility located...

    Stag Industrial (STAG -3.2%) dips after acquiring a warehouse and distribution facility located in Spartanburg, South Carolina for $9.1M. The property is has an area of around 409K square feet, and is 100% leased to Louis Dreyfus Commodities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • PTC

    Parametric Technology (PMTC -3%) extends Thursday's 21% rout after the company's FQ2 warning....

    Parametric Technology (PMTC -3%) extends Thursday's 21% rout after the company's FQ2 warning. Canaccord downgrades shares to Hold despite believing in PMTC's technological leadership in its product lifecycle management software. Though seeing long-term growth potential, the firm thinks it will take "a few quarters of solid execution to regain investor conviction."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (STX +3.6%) shares enjoy a boost off a burst of positive analyst commentary....

    Seagate Technology (STX +3.6%) shares enjoy a boost off a burst of positive analyst commentary. Brean Murray believes recent weakness in STX and Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) was caused by spot channel pricing which was lower but that fresh drive pricing was strong. Craig-Hallum sees a buying opportunity and says channel pricing concerns are misguided.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • ITMN

    InterMune (ITMN -16.4%) tumbles on news that a key clinical trial for its respiratory drug...

    InterMune (ITMN -16.4%) tumbles on news that a key clinical trial for its respiratory drug Esbriet has been delayed. Last week, ITMN said it didn't expect enrollment for the Phase 3 clinical trial to be completed until the end of 2012; it had previously forecast enrollment would be completed in Q2. Citing the delay, Jefferies and Leerink Swann cut price targets on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • VALV

    Chinese microcap Shengkai Innovations (VALV -8%) reverses an earlier 20% gain to trade lower...

    Chinese microcap Shengkai Innovations (VALV -8%) reverses an earlier 20% gain to trade lower after disclosing in a regulatory filing that it had appointed Linbin Zhang as interim Chief Financial Officer effective April 19.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • AVP

    Avon (AVP -3%) shares are sliding, not because new CEO Sherilyn McCoy isn't a worthy choice -...

    Avon (AVP -3%) shares are sliding, not because new CEO Sherilyn McCoy isn't a worthy choice - she was highly regarded at J&J - but the timing of the appointment a week after Coty's $10B takeover offer was turned down is "a clear sign" the board "is actively resisting" the offer, Bernstein says. The firm also fears that AVP "rushed into the decision."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOH

    Cantor weighs in on Molina Healthcare (MOH -25%) downgrading the shares to Hold on valuation...

    Cantor weighs in on Molina Healthcare (MOH -25%) downgrading the shares to Hold on valuation after the company failed to win a role in Ohio's expanded Medicaid program. Ohio was MOH's largest single health plan market in 2011 and accounted for nearly 22% of premium revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -4.8%) shares sink after calling attention to a medical journal article...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -4.8%) shares sink after calling attention to a medical journal article that shows Medtronic's (MDT -0.9%) heart device leads resulted in fewer deaths than its recalled Riata and Riata ST products. STJ says the article "substantially undercounted" deaths associated with MDT's Quattro Secure device and wants it retracted.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • LVS

    Shares of Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.6%) crash through the $60 barrier while setting a 52-week high...

    Shares of Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.6%) crash through the $60 barrier while setting a 52-week high on heavy-than-normal trading volume. DailyFinance notes that the company boasts a cash king margin of over 10%, in what it sees as a "good predictor" of sustained long-term returns.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.1%) swings without a safety net after reportedly removing most of its...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.1%) swings without a safety net after reportedly removing most of its derivative hedges against gas and oil prices for 2012 and 2013. It's a big reversal in philosophy for a company that once bragged of being "the best in the industry” at natural-gas hedging.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 12 Comments
  • ACTA

    ICG Group (ICGE +5.8%) pops on an upgrade to Strong Buy on valuation at Feltl, citing synergies...

    ICG Group (ICGE +5.8%) pops on an upgrade to Strong Buy on valuation at Feltl, citing synergies from its MSDSonline acquisition and Procurian deal flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • SFLY

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY -7.4%) drop lower in a heartbeat after Facebook snaps up Instagram in...

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY -7.4%) drop lower in a heartbeat after Facebook snaps up Instagram in a move that potentially poses a bigger threat to the company's fortunes than an indy Instagram.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -2.6%) slips after BofA Merrill Lynch cut estimates, citing margin pressures...

    First Solar (FSLR -2.6%) slips after BofA Merrill Lynch cut estimates, citing margin pressures and concerns regarding project pipeline growth. The firm says its latest round of checks suggest a cost per watt for leading silicon vendors below $0.65 by the middle of next year, and it doesn't see how the company can make money at level.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA +1.3%) pokes out a gain after a research note from Monness, Crespi, Hardt &...

    Sodastream (SODA +1.3%) pokes out a gain after a research note from Monness, Crespi, Hardt & Co.'s Jim Chartier indicates March data shows strong sales of the firm's products. Adding to the positive sentiment is a report tipping off that the company is exploring launching a new product line with a cosmetics partner.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • PLCM

    Polycom's (PLCM -3.8%) sales challenges are probably of its own making, RBC says as it...

    Polycom's (PLCM -3.8%) sales challenges are probably of its own making, RBC says as it downgrades shares and cuts its target price to $19 from $26 following last week's Q1 warning. PLCM has been revamping its sales force in North America, RBC notes, adding "poor execution and inconsistent messaging" seem to raise the likelihood of worst-case forecasts.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • SVU

    SuperValu (SVU +2.1%) sees a wave of bearish bets pile up as concerns over the viability of the...

    SuperValu (SVU +2.1%) sees a wave of bearish bets pile up as concerns over the viability of the supermarket chain mount. Since the end of 2011, short positions in SVU have jumped 41% to 72.9M shares - repping about a third of all outstanding shares. SA author Jeffrey Moore presents the bull case for a turnaround that he says could mimic the one at Steak n' Shake. SVU -35.4% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • AOL

    AOL's (AOL +44.1%) patent sale to Microsoft (MSFT -0.7%) fetched at least three times the...

    AOL's (AOL +44.1%) patent sale to Microsoft (MSFT -0.7%) fetched at least three times the expected price, Benchmark says; most of Wall Street viewed the patents as worth a maximum of $300M, meaning AOL effectively pulled $7.63/share "out of thin air" to hand to investors. Benchmark hikes its price target on the shares to $28 from $18. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -3.1%) slides on a Macquarie downgrade to neutral on fears of increased...

    MetroPCS (PCS -3.1%) slides on a Macquarie downgrade to neutral on fears of increased competition from T-Mobile USA in the prepaid phone space. The firm adds that the company's 4G LTE network is limited to just a few cities, and reported attempts to sell itself raise doubts about the company's long-term future.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca (AZN -0.3%) starts to hear a growing chorus of investors and analysts calling for a...

    AstraZeneca (AZN -0.3%) starts to hear a growing chorus of investors and analysts calling for a major shakeup of its board and management team amid a bit of a downward spiral. Bernstein Research's Jack Scannell thinks that instead of having marketing execs and attorneys running the show - the company should turn to either an Attila the Hun type of cost-slasher or a visionary scientist to right the ship.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • BA

    Now that it has overtaken Airbus as the no. 1 aircraft producer, Boeing (BA -1.8%) is now poised...

    Now that it has overtaken Airbus as the no. 1 aircraft producer, Boeing (BA -1.8%) is now poised to profit from 787 Dreamliners and 737 planes that have caused difficulty in recent years, Maxim says in projecting a $90 price target: “After years of design and testing for these two aircraft, we believe it is now time for Boeing to ring the cash register."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • CAR

    Avis Budget Group Inc. (CAR -3.3%) dips after saying on Friday it was removing about 10K Ford...

    Avis Budget Group Inc. (CAR -3.3%) dips after saying on Friday it was removing about 10K Ford Focus sedans from its rental fleet in the U.S., Canada and Puerto Rico amid a safety recall related to potential problems with windshield-wiper motors. The recall affects certain 2012 models manufactured at one Ford (F -2.6%) plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • EVR

    Evercore Partners (EVR -4.8%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral at BofA/Merrill, citing...

    Evercore Partners (EVR -4.8%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral at BofA/Merrill, citing weak Q1 activity and the recent decline its its revenue pipeline. The firm also lowers its rice target
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANTM

    Amerigroup (AGP -4.9%) and WellCare Health Plans (WCG -6.7%) trade lower as the firms stand to...

    Amerigroup (AGP -4.9%) and WellCare Health Plans (WCG -6.7%) trade lower as the firms stand to lose business from a decision by the state Ohio to change contracts for Medicaid health plans. (Previous: CNC, MOH)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • TITN

    Titan Machinery (TITN +6.2%) moves higher after being upgraded to Outperform at RW Baird, citing...

    Titan Machinery (TITN +6.2%) moves higher after being upgraded to Outperform at RW Baird, citing improved agricultural sector end markets and strong regional construction sector growth in the Bakken shale. The firm raises its price target to $37 from $29.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM

  • South Korean ETFs SKOR and EWY trade lower than other Asia-based ETFs, not helped at all by a...

    South Korean ETFs SKOR and EWY trade lower than other Asia-based ETFs, not helped at all by a report from government officials tipping off that recent satellite images show North Korea might be digging a new underground tunnel in preparation for another nuclear test.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • FRO

    Shares of Frontline (FRO +2.4%) spike higher after trading in negative territory earlier....

    Shares of Frontline (FRO +2.4%) spike higher after trading in negative territory earlier. Sparking the quick rally is chatter that the shipping company is in play as a takeover target.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • TSLA

    Abu Dhabi National Energy sells off its stake in Tesla Motors (TSLA -2.1%), according to...

    Abu Dhabi National Energy sells off its stake in Tesla Motors (TSLA -2.1%), according to reports. The state-owned utility company had held close to 7% of Tesla's shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 6 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate's (LGF -1.7%) The Hunger Games continues to dominate at the box office, as it notches...

    Lions Gate's (LGF -1.7%) The Hunger Games continues to dominate at the box office, as it notches its third consecutive weekend as the top grossing U.S. movie in beating out a new entry in the American Pie comedy series and a 3-D re-release of Titanic.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • GBX

    Shares of Greenbrier Companies (GBX +3.8%) post a gain after the company knocks out a FQ2...

    Shares of Greenbrier Companies (GBX +3.8%) post a gain after the company knocks out a FQ2 earning beat. The company delivered 68% more units Y/Y in the quarter as it added production lines and increased production rates on existing lines to keep up with higher demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • BB

    Sterne Agee's Shaw Wu breaks down the value of Research In Motion's (RIMM +3.3%) various pieces,...

    Sterne Agee's Shaw Wu breaks down the value of Research In Motion's (RIMM +3.3%) various pieces, and sees “intrinsic value" in RIM but isn't sure "if a price of over $7B makes sense.” He sees a valuation range of $5B-$7B, for a stock price of $9.50-$13.50; current market cap is ~$6.6B. RIM’s patents might not be all that valuable, Wu contends.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 4 Comments
  • CKSW

    ClickSoftware (CKSW -12.1%) trades sharply lower after missing the consensus estimate of...

    ClickSoftware (CKSW -12.1%) trades sharply lower after missing the consensus estimate of analysts with its Q1 report. CEO Dr. Moshe BenBassat calls the misfire nothing more than "seasonal first quarter softness."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • NLY

    Annaly (NLY +0.6%) is upped to a buy at Compass Point. As Dividend Master notes, something does...

    Annaly (NLY +0.6%) is upped to a buy at Compass Point. As Dividend Master notes, something does not compute when mortgage REITs that invest only in agency paper are getting sold (NLY is off 3% in a month, -9% Y/Y) while MBS prices MBB are ripping to a near 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 15 Comments
  • CALL

    MagicJack (CALL +9.8%) issues upside guidance for Q1, with EPS of $0.26 vs. $0.14 consensus,...

    MagicJack (CALL +9.8%) issues upside guidance for Q1, with EPS of $0.26 vs. $0.14 consensus, with revenues of $37.4M vs. $34.1M consensus. The company says it hopes to repurchase the maximum amount available under its current share buyback program and will seek approval to increase the program by an additional $20M. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • GOLD

    Randgold Resources (GOLD +9.1%) rallies after landing an upgrade from Stifel Nicolaus to Buy...

    Randgold Resources (GOLD +9.1%) rallies after landing an upgrade from Stifel Nicolaus to Buy from Hold along with a $110 price target. Analysts cite the mining company's attractive exploration potential and stable margin outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • ZEP

    Cleaning products manufacturer Zep (ZEP +3.6%) says its FQ2 net income rose 9% on strong sales...

    Cleaning products manufacturer Zep (ZEP +3.6%) says its FQ2 net income rose 9% on strong sales in its retail and distribution channels and expects results will continue to improve during H2. Zep earned $0.11/share vs. $0.09 consensus and $0.10 in the prior-year period.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) says it hasn’t been able to clear the blockage at its Davy...

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) says it hasn’t been able to clear the blockage at its Davy Jones No. 1 well in the Gulf of Mexico, so it will remove tubing and clear residual draining fluid. MMR expects a measurable flow rate from the well this quarter and “commercial production shortly thereafter.” MMR -2.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • SHW

    Shares of Sherwin-Williams (NYSE:SHW) move up 2.4% premarket after the company increases its...

    Shares of Sherwin-Williams (NYSE:SHW) move up 2.4% premarket after the company increases its outlook for Q1 EPS to $0.92-$0.95 from prior guidance of $0.56-$0.74 after seeing strong sales for its Paint Stores Group during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNC

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) -6.7% premarket after saying it was not awarded a contract to continue...

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) -6.7% premarket after saying it was not awarded a contract to continue serving Medicaid members in Ohio. CNC plans to appeal the decision, which if upheld would impact 9% of the 1.8M members the company had on Dec. 31. Susquehanna downgrades the health insurer to Neutral. (also: MOH receives similar bad news)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • HOGS

    Zhongpin (NASDAQ:HOGS) trades 13.4% lower premarket after getting embroiled in an insider...

    Zhongpin (NASDAQ:HOGS) trades 13.4% lower premarket after getting embroiled in an insider trading case. The accounts of six people were frozen on allegations tied to trading on shares of the Chinese pork processor.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: As Europe enjoys a day off for Easter Monday, U.S. stock futures fall following...

    Market preview: As Europe enjoys a day off for Easter Monday, U.S. stock futures fall following Friday's disappointing jobs report, with the S&P benchmark -1.1%. AOL soars a rather dizzying 35% on a $1B+ patent deal with Microsoft (-0.9%), whose own shares yawn. Avon -3.9% after naming a new top lady. Later: Employment Trends Index, Bernanke.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AOL

    Premarket gainers: AOL +35%. GOLD +7%. SCLN +4%.Losers: MOH -22%. HOGS -11%. OPTR -5%. RDN -4%....

    Premarket gainers: AOL +35%. GOLD +7%. SCLN +4%.
    Losers: MOH -22%. HOGS -11%. OPTR -5%. RDN -4%. AVP -4%. ALU -4%. DRYS -3%. S -3%. X -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) +1.5% premarket after announcing its proven and probable reserves of rare-earth...

    Molycorp (MCP) +1.5% premarket after announcing its proven and probable reserves of rare-earth minerals at its flagship Mountain Pass, Calif., facility have increased by 36%. MCP's reserves are now at 18.4M short tons of rare-earth ore at an ore grade of 7.98% and a cut-off grade of 5%, up from a 2010 estimate of 13.6M short tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG) move up 12.8% premarket on more patent speculation kickstarted by the...

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG) move up 12.8% premarket on more patent speculation kickstarted by the AOL-MSFT deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • AOL

    While shares of AOL and other patent-holding tech names (I, II) soar to such great heights,...

    While shares of AOL and other patent-holding tech names (I, II) soar to such great heights, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) trades roughly in-line with S&P futures after snapping up a billion dollars plus in new patents - down 1.1% premarket. The company's General Counsel says AOL's portfolio has been on the radar of Microsoft for years.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) -20% premarket after reportedly failing to win a role in Ohio's...

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) -20% premarket after reportedly failing to win a role in Ohio's expanded Medicaid program. Cantor Fitzgerald cuts shares to Hold from Buy, writing "offsetting the loss of more than 20% of its revenue could be difficult, particularly since new markets are initially less profitable." Shares also are downgraded at Susquehanna.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • TJX

    Nomura keeps TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) lined up with a Buy rating and takes its price target on...

    Nomura keeps TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) lined up with a Buy rating and takes its price target on shares up to $43 from $38. The retailer smashed estimates for same-store sales last week and sees upside in off-price inventory. Shares -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • EMN

    Goldman Sachs slides in Eastman Chemical (NYSE:EMN) with a Conviction Buy rating as analysts see...

    Goldman Sachs slides in Eastman Chemical (NYSE:EMN) with a Conviction Buy rating as analysts see lower propane and ethane prices boosting the firm's results. Shares -1.0% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • IDCC

    Shares of InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) and VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) catch some interest from traders...

    Shares of InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) and VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) catch some interest from traders looking for firms holding tech patents following the AOL-MSFT mega-deal. Premarket: IDCC +5.5%, VHC +4.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • OPTR

    Shares of Optimer Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OPTR) come off their trading halt down 4.7% premarket...

    Shares of Optimer Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OPTR) come off their trading halt down 4.7% premarket after the firm cleans house and warns that Q1 revenue will be lower than the estimates of analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM
  • AOL

    Shares of AOL roar 26.1% higher premarket after the company announces a patent deal with...

    Shares of AOL roar 26.1% higher premarket after the company announces a patent deal with Microsoft. The firm says that it will return a significant portion of the sales proceeds to shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM | 1 Comment
